[LIST_ITEM] Primary prevention offers an opportunity to interrupt the costly cycle of managing hypertension.
[LIST_ITEM] Lifestyle modifications have been shown to lower blood pressure.
[LIST_ITEM] A population-wide approach may reduce morbidity and mortality; trials are lacking.
[LIST_ITEM] Most patients with hypertension do not sufficiently change their lifestyle or adhere to drug therapy enough to achieve control.
[H1] Goal of Hypertension Prevention and Management.
[LIST_ITEM] To reduce morbidity and mortality by the least intrusive means possible. This may be accomplished by
[LIST_ITEM] Achieving and maintaining SBP < 140 mm Hg and DBP < 90 mm Hg.
